title: US Navy investigation finds submarine crash in South China Sea was 'preventable'
description: A Navy investigation into the October crash of a submarine into an underwater ridge in the South China Sea was "preventable" and followed navigation planning and risk management mistakes as well as other errors.

title: Satellite images appear to show Russian ships loading up with Ukrainian grain in Crimea
description: Russia's theft of Ukrainian grain appears to be ramping up as it continues its war on the country, according to new satellite photos of the Crimean port of Sevastopol.

title: Here's what Germany's economy minister proposes for tackling inflation
description: German Economy Minister Robert Habeck says the world is facing simultaneous crises across energy, climate and food sectors, and he discusses a looming threat of recession. Habeck underscores the importance of zeroing in on solutions.

title: Kate Moss expected to be called by Johnny Depp's legal team as a witness
description: Kate Moss, who dated Johnny Depp in the 1990s, is expected to be called to testify as a rebuttal witness by his legal team in the ongoing trial between Depp and his ex-wife Amber Heard, a source close to Depp tells CNN.

title: Hubble identifies unusual wrinkle in expansion rate of the universe
description: Measuring the expansion rate of the universe  was one of the Hubble Space Telescope's main goals when it was launched in 1990.

title: Special forces vet in Ukraine: 'It really comes down to good vs. evil'
description: CNN's Sam Kiley speaks to a team of elite special forces veterans who have traveled to Ukraine to join the fight against Russia.

title: 'Unclear details': Analyst on US military commitment to Taiwan
description: Global affairs analyst Susan Glasser and military analyst Cedric Leighton join CNN's Alisyn Camerota to discuss President Joe Biden's remarks on the US intervening militarily if China were to attack Taiwan.

title: Stocks surge thanks to big rally for JPMorgan Chase and other banks
description: Investors took a break from selling in May and going away, for one day at least.

title: Concertgoers in Russia chant "F*** the war!"
description: Audience members at a Кис-Киc (Kis-Kis) concert in St. Petersburg, Russia, were seen chanting "F**k the war!" according to a video shared online, which was verified by CNN.

title: China issues warning after Biden says US would respond militarily to an attack on Taiwan
Analysis: Biden's new stance of strategic confusion on Taiwan
description: If a US President keeps vowing to do something, and his aides keep insisting he won't, no one is sure what to believe -- a potential dangerous state of affairs on fraught international issues.

title: China warns US after Biden says it would respond militarily to attack on Taiwan
description: • Analysis: Biden's new stance of strategic confusion on Taiwan

title: Expert witness disputes cause of Johnny Depp's severed finger
description: CNN's Jean Casarez gives an update on the ongoing trial between Johnny Depp and Amber Heard, including orthopedic surgeon Dr. Richard Moore's testimony disputing Depp's claims about his finger injury.

title: It's the United States' party. But Mexico wants a say on the guest list
description: A growing number of countries are threatening to snub the US-hosted Summit of the Americas next month, amid controversy over its guest list.

title: Global economy being brought to the edge of a precipice
description: The global economy is being brought to the edge of a precipice by crisis upon crisis.

title: Didi's disastrous foray onto Wall Street is over
description: Shareholders will vote Monday on Didi's plan to quit the New York Stock Exchange less than a year after China's largest ride-hailing firm launched its $4.4 billion initial public offering.

title: Israeli judge's ruling on Jews who prayed in Al-Aqsa compound ignites controversy
description: A court in Jerusalem has issued a controversial ruling that critics say threatens the fragile agreement regulating access to Jerusalem's most disputed holy sites.

title: Tomatoes have been gene edited to provide more vitamin D
description: Fish and dairy products are the best dietary sources of vitamin D, which can make it a struggle for those on a plant-based diet to get enough of the essential micronutrient. Vitamin D helps protect our bones and keep muscles and teeth healthy.

title: Pete Davidson, Kate McKinnon, Aidy Bryant and Kyle Mooney's signature 'SNL' moments
description: "Saturday Night Live" bid farewell to Kate McKinnon, Aidy Bryant, Pete Davidson and Kyle Mooney on Saturday.

title: Pakistan's Imran Khan doubles down on ​unfounded claim that US plotted his downfall
description: Pakistan's Imran Khan repeated his claims Monday that the United States had orchestrated his ouster, saying that "anti-Americanism" was growing in the South Asian nation as a result of "all this becoming public."

title: Colin Cantwell, designer of 'Star Wars' Death Star, dies aged 90
description: Colin Cantwell, the visual effects artist behind many of the iconic spacecraft in the original "Star Wars" movie, has died at the age of 90.

title: See what capabilities Sweden's army could bring to NATO
description: CNN's Nina dos Santos takes a look at Sweden's armed forces and the ways its top-ranked air force could potentially benefit NATO.

title: Billie Eilish finds having Tourette's syndrome 'exhausting'
description: Spend enough time with Billie Eilish and you may notice her tics.

title: How abortion became a war over geography
description: The Supreme Court seems ready to undo Roe v. Wade, the landmark case recognizing the right to choose abortion, in a matter of weeks, and blue as well as red states are already preparing for what might be coming next: a conflict between states seeking to facilitate out-of-state travel for abortion and those trying to shut it down.

title: Princess Diana's 'priceless' wedding tiara exhibited for the first time in decades
description: Over the centuries, the tiara, something of a little sister to the omnipotent symbol of the crown, has come to represent more than just a membership to the monarchy. Closely connected to the romantic idea of a princess, it's a cultural shorthand for youth and femininity -- as well as status. From the plastic Cinderella tiaras worn by the millions of children that visit Disney theme parks each year, to the most recent Met Gala -- where multiple celebrities, including Blake Lively and even Anna Wintour herself, wore jewel-encrusted versions  -- the ancient accessory continues to be relevant today.

title: 'The Love Boat': How a TV show transformed the cruise industry
description: From steam-powered ships, to mega-liners, the cruise industry has been through quite a transformation over the years. And the market has skyrocketed.

title: Surreal photos show cosplay culture in a new light
description: In Thurstan Redding's photography series "Kids of Cosplay," the mundane and the fantastical collide in unexpected ways. Spiderman stares pensively into the middle distance as he grabs milk from a fridge. A group of Batmen cavort outside a small brick bungalow. X-men's Mystique lays across the street beneath an orange sky, cigarette in hand.

title: Russian officer reveals why he risked it all to quit Putin's war
description: It took a few weeks of sleeping on crates of grenades for a bed and hiding his face from Ukrainians amid a growing sense of guilt, for the Russian junior officer to come to his conclusion: This wasn't his battle to fight.

title: Analysis: China once dismissed the Quad. Now it's alarmed.
description: When the United States, Japan, Australia and India first resuscitated their informal dialogue from a decade-long hiatus in late 2017, China was confident it would soon fail.

title: Seven dead, seven missing after blaze on Philippine passenger ferry
description: Seven people have died after a high-speed Philippine ferry carrying 134 people caught fire on Monday, with seven passengers still missing, the coast guard said.

title: Ukrainians must endure a brutal 'filtration' process to escape Russian-held territory. Here's what that means
description: "What would happen if we cut off your ear?" the soldiers asked Oleksandr Vdovychenko. Then they hit him in the head.

title: Republicans look to Georgia for a path beyond Trump's 2020 grievances
description: Republican voters in Georgia's primary on Tuesday could move the party -- at least temporarily -- out from under former President Donald Trump's shadow.

title: Biden set to unveil his economic plan for countering China in Asia
description: President Joe Biden on Monday plans to unveil a long-sought economic plan for engaging a region coming increasingly under the influence of China, as he enters the second leg of his debut tour of Asia.

title: A new billionaire has been minted nearly every day during the pandemic
description: The Covid-19 pandemic has been good for the wallets of the wealthy.

title: 5 dead and hundreds of thousands without power after severe storms in Canada
description: Five people are reported dead after severe thunderstorms raced through parts of Canada on Saturday, according to Environment Canada.

title: More than 100 cases of monkeypox reported in 12 countries, including US
description: More cases of a rare disease have been reported worldwide, including in the United States -- where one health official said he expects more cases in the days ahead.

title: He's building a real-life yellow brick road without any bricks
description: There's a real-life yellow brick road forming in Ghana, and it shares at least one thing in common with the fictional path it's named for.

title: Australia's seismic election result explained
description: • Australian voters deliver strong message, ending conservative government's 9-year rule

title: Trevor Reed describes his release from Russian prison
description: Trevor Reed tells Jake Tapper how he found out about his release from a Russian prison and how he got back to the US in CNN's Special Report "Finally Home: The Trevor Reed Interview."

title: South Korea's coolest export isn't K-Pop, it's this drink
description: Kim Kyung-seop recalls going to cheap bars after class with his friends, where they binged on as much makgeolli as possible.

title: A Wisconsin couple survived after a bear charged through their window and attacked them
description: A couple was attacked by a bear inside their northern Wisconsin home Friday night after the animal broke through their window, authorities said.

title: Trevor Reed pushes back against critics of US participation in prisoner swaps
description: Trevor Reed, an American citizen recently freed after more than two years imprisoned in Russia, said in an exclusive interview with CNN that he does not believe the United States' participation in prisoner swaps to bring Americans home should be controversial.

title: Justin Thomas wins 2022 PGA Championship after dramatic three-hole playoff
description: Justin Thomas won the 2022 PGA Championship on Sunday, the second major of his career, after a dramatic playoff.

title: 'I felt guilty': Russian officer fighting in Ukraine quits
description: A former Russian officer who took part in the invasion of Ukraine tells CNN why he resigned his post. CNN's Suzanne Malveaux reports.
